intro: Rhamphicarpa heuglinii, commonly known as the Congo buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
